name: It's a Trap Quiz | Family Guy | 10 Questions

questions.text: How did Darth Vader die and by whose hand?
options: Laser through the stomach; Han Solo
questions.explanation:
Broken neck; Luke Skywalker.

	Luke Skywalker broke Darth Vader's neck after trying to remove his helmet so father and son could see each other. Darth Vader came to Luke as a ghost during the show's last scene and cussed Luke for killing him after Darth saved his life.

questions.text: Who killed Jabba the Hut during the battle at Tatooine?
questions.explanation:
Leia.

	While the fighting was going on, Leia took the chains binding her wrists and used them to choke Jabba. No one came to Jabba's rescue and Leia killed him. During the fight, Boba Fett was killed as well.

questions.text: To incite a battle between Luke Skywalker and Darth Vader, of what actor did the Emperor and Darth Vader constantly make fun?
questions.explanation:
Seth Green.

	The part of Chris had been played by Seth Green since the show's inception so having this actor being made fun of was the last straw for Luke Skywalker. He battled Darth Vader, eventually slicing off his arm, and killing the Emperor.

questions.text: Which credit card of Yoda's did Luke Skywalker use to purchase things over the phone?
questions.explanation:
Luke never said.

	After Yoda dies, Chris finds the wallet and uses an unnamed credit card to purchase things. He also learns that Yoda's full name is Yoda Parseghian. This is a joke referring to Notre Dame football player Ara Parseghian, who is known as the Yoda of Notre Dame Football.

questions.text: After the story was over, Chris asked Peter who was going to do the prequels. What show did Peter mention?
questions.explanation:
The Cleveland Show.

	After Peter finished telling the story, Chris asked him who would do the prequels. Peter told Chris he thought "The Cleveland Show" would do the prequels.  "The Cleveland Show" was cancelled after three seasons and never did parody the prequels. However, they did a parody of the first "Die Hard".

questions.text: What two shows did "Family Guy" borrow characters from to add more "Star Wars" characters to the episode?
options: "The Cleveland Show" and "King of the Hill"
questions.explanation:
"American Dad" and "The Cleveland Show".

	They used Klaus and Roger from "American Dad" and Tim and Rollo from "The Cleveland Show" Klaus played Admiral Ackbar and Roger played Moff Jerjerrod. Tim played Wicket the Ewok and Rollo played Niem Numb.

questions.text: When C3PO and R2D2 tricked their way into Jabba the Hut's inner circle in Tantooine, who did C3PO refer to Jabba the Hut as?
questions.explanation:
Alec Baldwin.

	C3PO was trying to butter up Jabba the Hut, but Jabba wasn't falling for it. Jabba was voiced by Patrick Warburton and portrayed by Joe Swanson.

questions.text: When Darth Vader entered the Death Star at the show's beginning, what movie was being advertised?
options: Tyler Perry's Meet the Death Star
questions.explanation:
Tyler Perry's Meet the Calrissians.

	When Darth Vader's ship entered the Death Star three posters were seen with a black family on them and the title shown above, Tyler Perry's "Meet the Calrissians".

questions.text: Everyone was seen being captured by Jabba's men, but Chewie. According to Chewie, how was he captured?
questions.correct: He was caught eating out of Jabba's trash
options: He was defecating on a Jabba the Hut figurine
He was whistling in a no whistling zone
He was trying to melt Han Solo out of the carbonite
questions.explanation:
He was caught eating out of Jabba's trash.

	Luke, Leia, C3PO, R2D2, and Han were taken captive by Jabba. They threw a blinded Han Solo into a cell with Chewie where Chewie told him he had been captured after eating out of Jabba's trash.

questions.text: What was the old access code that Han Solo used to enter the forest moon of Endor?
questions.explanation:
36749.

	The ship had been stolen so the code was old. When Darth Vader realized Luke and the others were on the ship, he allowed them onto Endor and then tried to capture them.
